pullRequest.body:
Fix a comment.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

This PR does two things: (1) removes `[Nontrivial V]` from an example in a comment (it's not used, and I need the trivial case!) and (2) changes a `by infer_instance` to `#synth` in the same comment.

nodes.body:
### PR summary [84f8401a61](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13709/commits/84f8401a61976ea986462f69798ccf911b7bbd82)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

Thanks; I like the idea. Just one question:

Is there a reason you're moving towards `#synth`? Sure, it works - I think `example` might be easier to understand for less experienced Lean users, so barring any other reasons, I'd prefer to use that.

I think `example` is easier to understand than `#synth`, but `#synth` is easier to understand than `by infer_instance`, which looks to me like a lean3ism which we no longer need because of `#synth`. But I am happy either way, I can just delete the `[Nontrivial V]` instead if you think this is better.
OK I've changed from `#synth` back to `inferInstance`.
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by kbuzzard.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9513885926/job/26224895716)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9513885926/job/26224896018)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
#synth LieGroup ùìò(ùïú, V ‚ÜíL[ùïú] V) (V ‚ÜíL[ùïú] V)À£  -- Units.instLieGroupModelWithCornersSelf
```
from the [Zulip discussion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113488-general/topic/bikeshedding.20about.20.23synth).

You meant to do this, right? With this change applied, feel free to `maintainer merge` on my behalf.
```suggestion
example {V : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup V] [NormedSpace ùïú V] [CompleteSpace V] :
In the Zulip discussion I had suggested switching `example` to `instance`. Feel free to ignore this suggestion ‚Äî I just wanted to make sure it wasn't overlooked.
Yeah I saw this and decided that `example` was less confusing because we probably don't want to accidentally imply that the user should make another instance.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - doc: units of a trivial normed algebra are a thing
